what: Metadata of the output columns of the TreeData package
title: TreeData
text: Comment (character): error type informations Bota - Family_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Family name - FamilyCorSource (character): source Family correction - Genus_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Genus name - Species_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Species name - BotanicalCorrectionSource (character): source Genus Species correction - ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character): corrected ScientificName - VernName_TreeDataCor (character): completed information available IdTree level. Life Status - LifeStatus_TreeDataCor (logical): corrected stem life status. Diameter - Diameter_TreeDataCor (numeric): corrected trees diameter default HOM - DiameterCorrectionMeth (character): diameter correction methode = “taper”/“local linear regression”/“weighted mean” /phylogenetic hierarchical(“species”/“genus”/“family”/“stand”)/“shift realignment”/“value”. - POM_TreeDataCor (factor): POM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st POM value stem measured - HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds DefaultHOM Taper correction applied. , corresponds 1st HOM value stem measured Recruitment - CorrectedRecruit (logical): TRUE: row added represent year stem larger minimum diameter, absent dataset. FALSE: original dataset row.

title: TreeData
text: Detect errors - Remove duplicated rows - Check missing value X-YTreeUTM/PlotArea/Plot/Subplot/Year/TreeFieldNum/ IdTree/IdStem/Diameter/POM/HOM/Family/Genus/Species/VernName - Check missing value (NA/0) measurement variables: “Diameter”, “HOM”, “TreeHeight”, “StemHeight” - Check unique association IdTree plot, subplot TreeFieldNum (site scale) - Check duplicated IdTree/IdStem census (site scale) - Check trees outside subplot (implemented yet) - Check invariant coordinates per IdTree/IdStem - Check fix Plot Subplot number (implemented yet)

title: TreeData
text: special characters (typography) family name Genus Species columns (suffix “aceae” specific family name. Correct spelling botanical names (Taxonstand WorldFlora) Family & Scientific names match (BIOMASS::getTaxonomy WorldFlora) Update scientific botanical names current phylogenetic classification Check invariant botanical informations per IdTree (1 IdTree = 1 family, 1 scientific 1 vernacular name)

title: TreeData
text: UseSize argument chosen : Diameter != NA -> Alive (value bold modified value given arrow): (“>” gives chronological order sequence) Dead > Alive -> NA add rows forgotten censuses 2 ‘Alive’ chosen Alive > Dead/NA > Alive -> Alive Alive > NA > Dead -> NA Alive > Dead > NA -> Dead Alive > NA > NA: DeathConfirmation > unseens -> NA DeathConfirmation =< unseens -> Dead

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdTree (character) Family (character) Genus (character) Species (character) VernName (character) ScientificName (character) Source (character, 1 value) correct standardise, can choose : "TPL": Plant List (http://www.theplantlist.org/) (faster based 2013 taxonomy) "WFO": World Flora Online (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/) (long time based 2022 taxonomy) WFOData Source = "WFO". Data setwith static copy World Flora Online (WFO) Taxonomic Backbone data (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/downloadData). data.frame data.table R, .rds file uploading Shiny App. Note classification.csv file downloaded website large uploaded App, needs opened R first, trimmed set species relevant , saved .rds file using function saveRDS().

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
code: if (FALSE) { library(data.table) data(TestData)  # With The Plant List: Rslt <- BotanicalCorrection(TestData, Source = "TPL")  ScfcCor <- unique(Rslt[ScientificNameCor != ScientificName,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor, FamilyCorSource,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  FamCor <- unique(Rslt[FamilyCor != Family,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor, FamilyCorSource,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  # With World Flora Online: WFO_Backbone <- file.choose() load(WFO_Backbone)  RsltWFO <- BotanicalCorrection(TestData, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone)  ScfcCor <- unique(RsltWFO[ScientificNameCor != ScientificName,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  FamCor <- unique(RsltWFO[FamilyCor != Family,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ]) }

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Diameter correction

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
code: DiameterCorrection(   Data,   UseTaperCorrection = TRUE,   DefaultHOM = 1.3,   TaperParameter = function(DAB, HOM) 0.156 - 0.023 * log(DAB) - 0.021 * log(HOM),   TaperFormula = function(DAB, HOM, TaperParameter, DefaultHOM)     DAB/(exp(-TaperParameter * (HOM - DefaultHOM))),   KeepMeas = c("MaxHOM", "MaxDate"),   PositiveGrowthThreshold = 5,   NegativeGrowthThreshold = -2,   Pioneers = NULL,   PioneersGrowthThreshold = 7.5,   WhatToCorrect = c("POM change", "Abnormal growth"),   CorrectionType = c("individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical"),   DBHRange = 10,   MinIndividualNbr = 5,   OtherCrit = NULL,   Digits = 1L,   DBHCorForDeadTrees = TRUE,   coef = 0.9 )

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdTree IdStem (character) ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) POM (Point Measurement) (factor) HOM (Height Measurement) (numeric) want correct "POM change" want apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction, dataset must also contain columns: Genus_TreeDataCor (character) Family_TreeDataCor (character) UseTaperCorrection (logical) TRUE: transform tree diameter measured given height diameter corresponding default measurement height (DefaultHOM), using allometry. FALSE: apply taper correction DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) TaperParameter Taper parameter (unitless) formula (function) Default: TaperParameter = 0.156 - 0.023 log(DAB) - 0.021 log(HOM) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) TaperFormula Taper formula (function) Default: DAB / (e^(- TaperParameter (HOM - DefaultHOM))) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) DefaultHOM:  Default Height Measurement (m) TaperParameter: Taper parameter (unitless) KeepMeas case multiple diameter measurements census year: Possible values: "MaxHOM", "MaxDate" (character). "MaxHOM": apply correction measurement taken highest POM "MaxDate": apply correction recent measurement (year recent date) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree widening value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census: possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) Pioneers Scientific names pioneer species site, ScientificName_TreeDataCor column (characters vector) PioneersGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree pioneer species widens value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) WhatToCorrect Possible values: "POM change", "Abnormal growth" (character) "POM change": detect POM change column POM correct Diameter values . (Ignored taper correction applied) "Abnormal growth": detect growth greater PositiveGrowthThreshold ('PioneersGrowthThreshold' species belongs 'Pioneers') smaller NegativeGrowthThreshold correct CorrectionType CorrectionType Possible values: "individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical" (character, 1 value). "individual": replace abnormal growth interpolation individual values. "phylogenetic hierarchical": replace abnormal growth average growth trees dataset, specific, genus, family stand level, within DBH range x cm (DBHRange argument). number trees < n (MinIndividualNbr argument) specific level, switch genus level etc. DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) Digits Number decimal places used DBHCor column (Default: 1L) (integer) DBHCorForDeadTrees (logical) TRUE: return DBHCor also dead trees. FALSE: return DBHCor dead trees. case advisable corrected tree life status StatusCorrection() function. coef description... (numeric)

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Fill Comment_TreeData column error type informations add columns: Diameter_TreeDataCor: corrected trees diameter default HOM DiameterCorrectionMeth_TreeData = "local linear regression","weighted mean"/phylogenetic hierarchical("species"/"genus"/"family"/"stand")/ "shift realignment"/"value". POM_TreeDataCor (factor): POM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st POM value stem measured. HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st HOM value stem measured.

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: 1 Diameter value tree/stem, Diameter_TreeDataCor takes original Diameter value. value 0 > MaxDBH, Diameter_TreeDataCor takes NA. Diameters linked IdTree/IdStem Census Year processed. Punctual error correction linear regression quadratic, punctual errors corrected local regression 2 framing values.

Data setwith static copy World Flora Online (WFO) Taxonomic Backbone data (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/downloadData). data.frame data.table R, .rds file uploading Shiny App. Note classification.csv file downloaded website large uploaded App, needs opened R first, trimmed set species relevant , saved .rds file using function saveRDS(). DeathConfirmation Number times (censuses) needed unseen tree considered dead (numeric)  (Default = 2 censuses) UseSize Use size presence  (> min DBH) witness living status tree (logical) (Default = FALSE) AddRowsForForgottenCensuses TRUE: adds rows forgotten censuses, FALSE: add rows (logical). RemoveRBeforeAlive want delete rows tree seen alive 1st time? (logical) RemoveRAfterDeath correction want delete rows concerning tree death? (logical) UseTaperCorrection (logical) TRUE: transform tree diameter measured given height diameter corresponding default measurement height (DefaultHOM), using allometry. FALSE: apply taper correction DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) TaperParameter Taper parameter (unitless) formula (function) Default: TaperParameter = 0.156 - 0.023 log(DAB) - 0.021 log(HOM) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) TaperFormula Taper formula (function) Default: DAB / (e^(- TaperParameter (HOM - DefaultHOM))) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) DefaultHOM:  Default Height Measurement (m) TaperParameter: Taper parameter (unitless) KeepMeas case multiple diameter measurements census year: Possible values: "MaxHOM", "MaxDate" (character). "MaxHOM": apply correction measurement taken highest POM "MaxDate": apply correction recent measurement (year recent date) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree widening value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census: possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) Pioneers Scientific names pioneer species site, ScientificName_TreeDataCor column (characters vector) PioneersGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree pioneer species widens value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) WhatToCorrect Possible values: "POM change", "Abnormal growth" (character) "POM change": detect POM change column POM correct Diameter values . (Ignored taper correction applied) "Abnormal growth": detect growth greater PositiveGrowthThreshold ('PioneersGrowthThreshold' species belongs 'Pioneers') smaller NegativeGrowthThreshold correct CorrectionType CorrectionType Possible values: "individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical" (character, 1 value). "individual": replace abnormal growth interpolation individual values. "phylogenetic hierarchical": replace abnormal growth average growth trees dataset, specific, genus, family stand level, within DBH range x cm (DBHRange argument). number trees < n (MinIndividualNbr argument) specific level, switch genus level etc. DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) Digits Number decimal places used DBHCor column (Default: 1L) (integer) DBHCorForDeadTrees (logical) TRUE: return DBHCor also dead trees. FALSE: return DBHCor dead trees. case advisable corrected tree life status StatusCorrection() function. coef description... (numeric) OnlyDetectMissedRecruits TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (logical) MinDBH Minimum diameter trees inventoried (cm) (numeric, 1 value) NULL (Default) wish use MinDBH indicated data, may vary per plot

title: Full error processing — FullErrorProcessing
text: Detect errors detect correct errors: Check general errors (GeneralErrorsDetection) Check botanical identification (BotanicalCorrection) Check life status evolution trees/stems (StatusCorrection) Apply taper allometry diameters measured heights different default HOM (TaperCorrection) Check diameter evolution trees (DiameterCorrection) Check tree/stem recruitment (RecruitmentCorrection)

title: Full error processing — FullErrorProcessing
code: if (FALSE) { data(TestData) Rslt <- FullErrorProcessing(TestData,  OnlyDetectMissedRecruits = TRUE,   AddRowsForForgottenCensuses = FALSE)  WFO_Backbone <- file.choose() load(WFO_Backbone) Rslt_Test <- FullErrorProcessing(TestData, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone) Rslt_Panama <- FullErrorProcessing(PanamaFormated, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone) }

title: SCBISubsetFormated — SCBISubsetFormated
text: standardized version subset Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute's ForestGEO plot's data, errors introduced test correction functions

title: SCBISubsetFormated — SCBISubsetFormated
code: SCBISubsetFormated

title: SCBISubsetFormated — SCBISubsetFormated
text: tibble MinDBH minimum diameter trees included inventory IdCensus Census identifier Year Year measurement Month Month measurement Day Day measurement Date, DateOriginal Date measurement Site Site level name Cluster Cluster ID name (created accommodate ForestPlots network's cluster, groups similar plots used data packages create local allometries. Note useful also keep Site (PlotName) users able check duplicate datasets multiple networks). Plot Plot level name PlotViewID additional plot protocol identifier useful indicate plot protocol changed /different soil type/disturbance... (created accommodate ForestPlots network). Subplot Subplot level name PlotArea Size plot PlotElevation plot's elevation meters sea level SubplotArea Size plot PlotLat Plot's latitude degrees PlotLon Plot's longitude degrees XPlotUTM Plot's X UTM coordinates YPlotUTM Plot's Y UTM coordinates SubplotLat Subplot's latitude degrees SubplotLon Subplot's longitude degrees XSubplotUTM Subplot's X UTM coordinates YSubplotUTM Subplot's Y UTM coordinates ScientificName, ScientificNameOriginal Scientific name VernName Vernacular name Family Family name Genus Genus name Species Species name Subspecies Subspecies name Variety Variety name Voucher Voucher code species IdLevel Deepest taxonomic level full identification known Authority Taxonomic authority ID level CommercialSp Logical: TRUE species considered commercial, FALSE LifeForm Life form TreeFieldNum, TreeFieldNumOriginal Tree unique identifiers, matching tag number field. IdTree, IdTreeOriginal Tree unique identifiers. automatically generated provided input data (using plot tree tag information). StemFieldNum, StemFieldNumOriginal Stem identifiers within tree. IdStem, IdStemOriginal Stem unique identifiers. automatically generated provided input data (using plot tree stem tag information). IdMeasure measure unique identifier one measure per stem per year TreeLat Tree Latitude degrees TreeLon Tree Longitude degrees XTreeUTM Tree X UTM coordinates YTreeUTM Tree Y UTM coordinates XTreePlot Tree X euclidean position plot YTreePlot Tree Y euclidean position plot XTreeSubplot Tree X euclidean position subplot YTreeSubplot Tree Y euclidean position subplot LifeStatus, LifeStatusOriginal Logical: TRUE tree alive, FALSE dead Diameter Tree Diameter BD Basal diameter Circ Circumference BCirc Basal circumference HOM Height measurement POM Code point measurement tree diameter BHOM Height measurement basal diameter BPOM Code point measurement basal diameter TreeHeight Tree Height

title: Status Correction — StatusCorrection
text: Detect errors, detect errors correct, tree life status evolution censuses. Inspired code Nino Page package (ForestData::correct_alive() .correct_alive_tree())

title: Status Correction — StatusCorrection
code: StatusCorrection(   Data,   DeathConfirmation = 2,   UseSize = TRUE,   AddRowsForForgottenCensuses = TRUE,   RemoveRBeforeAlive = FALSE,   RemoveRAfterDeath = FALSE )

title: Status Correction — StatusCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) LifeStatus column must coded : - TRUE = alive, - FALSE = dead, - NA = unseen DeathConfirmation Number times (censuses) needed unseen tree considered dead (numeric)  (Default = 2 censuses) UseSize Use size presence  (> min DBH) witness living status tree (logical) (Default = FALSE) AddRowsForForgottenCensuses TRUE: adds rows forgotten censuses, FALSE: add rows (logical). RemoveRBeforeAlive want delete rows tree seen alive 1st time? (logical) RemoveRAfterDeath correction want delete rows concerning tree death? (logical)

title: Status Correction — StatusCorrection
text: Fill Comment_TreeData column error type informations add LifeStatus_TreeDataCor column corrected trees life status.

title: Status Correction — StatusCorrection
text: UseSize : Diameter != NA -> Alive (value bold modified value given arrow): (">" gives chronological order sequence) Dead > Alive -> NA add rows forgotten censuses 2 'Alive' chosen Alive > Dead/NA > Alive -> Alive Alive > NA > Dead -> NA Alive > Dead > NA -> Dead Alive > NA > NA: DeathConfirmation > unseens -> NA DeathConfirmation =< unseens -> Dead

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: Transform tree diameter measured given height diameter corresponding default measurement height (HOM), using allometry.

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
code: TaperCorrection(   Data,   DefaultHOM = 1.3,   TaperParameter = function(DAB, HOM) 0.156 - 0.023 * log(DAB) - 0.021 * log(HOM),   TaperFormula = function(DAB, HOM, TaperParameter, DefaultHOM)     DAB/(exp(-TaperParameter * (HOM - DefaultHOM))) )

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: Diameter (numeric) HOM (Height Measurement) (numeric) DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) TaperParameter Taper parameter (unitless) formula (function) Default: TaperParameter = 0.156 - 0.023 log(DAB) - 0.021 log(HOM) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) TaperFormula Taper formula (function) Default: DAB / (e^(- TaperParameter (HOM - DefaultHOM))) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) DefaultHOM:  Default Height Measurement (m) TaperParameter: Taper parameter (unitless)

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: Fill Comment_TreeData column error type informations add columns: - Diameter_TreeDataCor: corrected trees diameter default HOM - DiameterCorrectionMeth = "taper" - HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM corresponding Diameter_TreeDataCor (= DefaultHOM)

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
code: library(data.table)  Data <- data.table(IdStem = "A",       ScientificName = "Tree",       Year = c(1998, 2008, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2021),       Diameter = c(19, 19, 21.4, 22.6, 23.1, 23.1, 23.6),       HOM = c(1.30, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25))  Rslt <- TaperCorrection(Data) DiameterCorrectionPlot(Rslt, CorCol = "Diameter_TreeDataCor")
